rev.comment: /* General Strike on November 15 and later events */ create section for upcoming UC-wide event

Line 44: Line 44:
On November 18th, newspaper reports indicate that [[UC Davis]] police officers used pepper spray on protesters sitting peacefully on the ground.<ref>{{cite news | newspaper=[[The Cleveland Leader]] | title=UC Davis Police Brutally Pepper Spray OWS Protesters Sitting Peacefully on Campus | url=http://www.clevelandleader.com/node/17846 | first=Julie | last= Kent | date= 19 November 2011 | accessdate = 21 Nobember 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |newspaper= [[Los Angeles Times]] |title=UC Davis chief launches probe into pepper-spraying of Occupy protesters |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/local/la-me-occupy-uc-davis-20111120,0,2407596.story |first1=Paul |last1= Pringle | first2=Sam
On November 18th, newspaper reports indicate that [[UC Davis]] police officers used pepper spray on protesters sitting peacefully on the ground.<ref>{{cite news | newspaper=[[The Cleveland Leader]] | title=UC Davis Police Brutally Pepper Spray OWS Protesters Sitting Peacefully on Campus | url=http://www.clevelandleader.com/node/17846 | first=Julie | last= Kent | date= 19 November 2011 | accessdate = 21 Nobember 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |newspaper= [[Los Angeles Times]] |title=UC Davis chief launches probe into pepper-spraying of Occupy protesters |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/local/la-me-occupy-uc-davis-20111120,0,2407596.story |first1=Paul |last1= Pringle | first2=Sam
| last2=Quinones | date= 19 November 2011 | accessdate = 21 Nobember 2011}}</ref> The close proximity of Berkeley and Davis, university-provided shuttle service between campuses, and ties between Occupy Cal and [[Occupy UC Davis]] suggest this most recent police action will cause further unrest and have already prompted statements from UC President [[Mark Yudof]] calling for a review of police procedures.
| last2=Quinones | date= 19 November 2011 | accessdate = 21 Nobember 2011}}</ref> The close proximity of Berkeley and Davis, university-provided shuttle service between campuses, and ties between Occupy Cal and [[Occupy UC Davis]] suggest this most recent police action will cause further unrest and have already prompted statements from UC President [[Mark Yudof]] calling for a review of police procedures.
  +   +
==November 28 general strike==
  +
On November 21, a 1,729 person General Assembly was held on the UC Davis campus. That body voted (with 99.5% consensus) to stage an education-wide general strike on Monday, November 28th.<ref>[http://www.occupyucdavis.org/ "Occupy UC Davis Calls for a General Strike"]</ref>
